text.author: Glen Krutz and Sylvie Waskiewicz
text.title: American Government 2e. What is Government?
text.summary: This section of a textbook explains and exemplifies different types of government, including representative democracy as in the United States, direct democracy as in ancient Athens, monarchy as in Saudi Arabia, oligarchy as in Cuba's reigning Communist Party, and totalitarianism as in North Korea.

figure.rend: A map of the world labeled to indicate the forms of government in each country. A legend to the left reads 'Representative democracy', 'Oligarchy', and 'Monarchy'. A small number of countries are labeled 'Oligarchy', and a very small number are labeled 'Monarchy'. The large majority of countries are labeled 'Representative democracy'.
